intro: Monactis pallatangensis, commonly known as the Pallatanga monactis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cold, dry conditions of its habitat. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, fibrous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
